questions: How do you define the connection between the HTML and your app in src/index.js?
What is the class name of the div in index.html?
What is the widgetName in src/index.js?
answer:
## Connecting the app container with the code You will need to define __connection between the HTML and your app__. The `src/index.js` file is responsible for this. It is done in `const widgetName = 'tracardi-uix-your-name'` and `const widgetDivs = document.querySelectorAll('.'+widgetName)` line. You also need to reference this name in `index.html`. See the class of a div. === "src/index.js" ```javascript import React from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import App from './App'; const widgetName = 'tracardi-uix-your-name' // (1) const widgetDivs = document.querySelectorAll('.'+widgetName) widgetDivs.forEach(Div => { ReactDOM.render( , Div ); }) ``` 1. Your app placeholder class name. Please change it to yout app name and prefix it with: `tracardi-uix-`. This name must also be a class name for __div__ tag in `index.html` === "public/index.html" ```html Title
``` 1. Class name of `div` must be the same as `widgetName` in __src/index.js__
